page.title: 20Place Names
page.content: {History}has contributed to the formation of local place names. There is much dicussion about possible {derivations,}however no_one can be certain of their accuracy. The name {Maesteg}means fair fields, a good description of the area in pre_ industral times. The name{Nantyffyllon is a mutation of either Nant_y_ffyddlon meaning stream of the faithful or Nant-y-Ffyrlling, {Ffyrlling}meaning{farthing}in{Welsh. It is said that miners used to throw a coin (farthing) into the stream on their way to work for good luck, and that they should return past that point unharmed from their days work. The stream is called the Nant.
